But I think she was sincerely upset and tried to make restitution, which is what counts. I guess the lesson for the manager is that people can and will tell others about their experiences, and it will reflect, for better or worse, on their business. Therefore, it's important to train employees to handle this sort of complaint. And the lesson for me is, the next time something like this happens--go to the manager/owner on site ASAP and politely explain the problem. The cashier's reaction was almost as off-putting as the actual roach.  Yech.

7.description: My limited time working at the new office in sunny Scottsdale (not AZ) has proven a couple of things.1) Suburbia has spilled back into this southwestern strip of the city along Cicero Ave. with all of the chain stores and strip malls leading all the way down to Southwest Highway.2) The people in the area are very nice in general.3) If you are looking for buffet heaven away from the bright lights of Vegas, you can't do much better than Scottsdale.Now I haven't tried any other buffets other than this one (there are seemingly about 10 of them in this small area), but if the others are nearly as good, then my preconceived notions about poor quality of food at buffets here in Chicago should be thrown out the door.Here you will get a very American version of Chinese food, along with a hodge-podge of other American buffet staples like mac 'n cheese, chicken fingers, pizza and so forth.The thing about this place is that their dishes are consistently pretty good!  Considering the cost involved (about $8 for lunch) and that they offer a lot of different kinds of seafood, I think it is a great deal.The prawns are a great deal in themselves.  If you like tearing into the whole-bodied prawns and can't get enough of them- come here.  For $8 you can gorge yourself on as many as you can handle!

8.description: Oh boy....here I am writing a review for an Asian buffet....located in a suburban mall....The end of the world is fast approaching.That's a FACT.So does this place really deserve 4 stars?!? Not quite. But I want to push it up because really this little hole in the wall (ok, it's a figure of speech - it's actually quite big) does a pretty good job in its category. So....oomph.....move a little bit......up......a bit on the left....THERE.Here you go. 4 stars!!After hearing rave reviews about it from someone (clue: we share the same address) I decided that I wanted to give it a try, just to say that I had had lunch in Scottsdale. So after a few stops in a couple of glorious furniture stores, losing my phone, finding it at a store counter and calming my racing heart - we pushed the door, paid the $7.95, chose a table and started working our way.Traditional fare but a few things worth mentioning:- wonton soup- mussels in black bean sauce- onion prawns - gigantic and whole (yep, with the head. Love tearing them apart!) and most of all, perfectly cooked. A small miracle in a buffet!- crab legs- salmon on the plank (not very Chinese, sure, but still delicious)- steamed asparagus- octopus with chili peppersProbably not worth all the way down there but if you find yourself around for whatever reason (and I am sorry for you, really), a nice little spot to stop by.

9.description: I ate here about a week ago. It wasn't that bad. I don't feel it was worth 10.00. The place was very  clean.  The food wasn't that bad. I had sushi it was pretty good! All you can eat sushi! Yummy. I would visit it again, but only for lunch. It was cheaper!

10.description: This place was right across the street from the hotel I was staying at near Midway Airport.  That's the only reason I went.  All in all, you would be better off starving than spending $10.50 eating at this place.  It's no different from the millions of other Asian buffets; probably worse...

4.description: all the Chinese buffets in the area all have one thing in common....The quality of food is diminished. Was a fan of this place for years, but the last two times have found low food temperature and old food on the line. Complained to the cook, couldn't understand me but brought me fresh  hot crab Rangoon. Just sad how prices go up, but quality goes down.

0.description: Food came 2 hours later, and was ice cold.. will try again and see if it was just a bad day

28.description: Kenwood has the lowest prices of beer, wine or spirits anywhere. Well worth the trip to the south suburbs. As a matter of fact people come from as far away as Ohio to take advantage of the prices. Be prepared, the place is small with a great selection. But it can get very crowded and the parking lot gets hectic especially around holidays. And bring cash, they don't take credit cards.

1.description: Kenwood has always been the place to go for liquor if you happen to find yourself on the Southside. And i've been to their other location many times. So when I found out they had another location I had to check it out. It took quite a while before I actually got the chance to go to this location but I am glad I finally was able to get here. I must say I am very glad I did, not only did I realize this one is closer to me than I originally thought, but they seemed to have a slightly bigger selection than the other. And the best part about it no city tax, yeah!  Now being that I had more to get done that day, I didn't get to peruse the variety as I might've wanted to, but I did see that they have quite a variety to suit everyones tastes. Whether you're a wine drinker or you fancy liquid spirits, you're guaranteed to find what you are looking for here. Now like other reviewers have stated the parking lot is very small and compact, and can be quite a traffic jam when it's full. But it's hardly a deal breaker considering.I am looking forward to revisiting this place when I have a bit more free time. This place definitely has the potential to be one of my go to spots.

9.description: I think everyone in the SW burbs knows that Kenwood is the place to go for liquor - the cheapest prices around.   Seriously, they beat everyone on prices.   You see people leaving this place with cases and cases of beer, wine, spirits.   You don't just come here to pick up a 6-pack....you stock up.The place isn't big.  The aisles are not big.  The place is packed tight with as much alcohol as possible.  It is almost impossible for 2 people to be in aisle at the same time.  There are workers everywhere - trying to keep the place stocked.   Beer is flying off the shelves, stacks, friges as fast as they can stock it.  The prices are that good!Parking kind of sucks - they have a lot, but it is not big.  People are parking down the street and across the street.    I try to come at 'off' hours, and never on weekends.  Can't beat the prices!

29.description: Cheap prices. Always packed. Cash only. They will special order. Even better it's less than a block from my house!

23.description: This place is an experience. It's like watching an elaborate cuckoo clock of booze-- a small, perpetually crowded, filthy, bizarre cuckoo clock of booze. The cashiers look like they should be in a police lineup. The stock boys struggle to keep bottles on the shelves as what seems like the entire south side takes them away. I was here once on Christmas eve, and someone managed to get on the store intercom and started singing My Country Tis of Thee. Nobody batted an eye.In all seriousness this place has a wide and cheap selection, but getting it can be a complete ordeal.

5.description: Apothic Red Wine always on sale for $6.99 - everywhere else in the area the same bottle goes for $9.99 and up. Thank you Kenwood! Insane selection of craft beers and wines. It takes a few minutes to make up your mind with all of the options, which is a good thing.

31.description: The hard liquor prices are the best I've seen anywhere. The tequlia selection is extensive as is the whiskey, scotch and vodka. The beer is the best priced around and there is a good selection. The wine selection is something I've looked at, but  have never bought anything, it is a very basic  selection.   The champange prices are very good as well,  again the selection is basic.We stopped in last Saturday night at about 9:50 p.m.,  and as usual it was packed. I have never been here when it isn't  crowded or packed. Bring plenty of cash.

25.description: Update - they take credit cards now - woo hoo!  Fantastic prices (especially on wine) but the layout of the entry and 1st aisle as well as the parking lot are both a large pain in the butt.  There is a 15% discount on 6 bottles of wine - not just a case!  I am the "Northside" supplier of various cases of wine due to the fact their prices are $3.00 per bottle lower than Binny's - lol!

12.description: It's like a miny Binny's. Half the selection (which is still extensive especially given the size) and more often than not even lower prices! I've found handles of Johnny Walker cheaper at Costco and a few beer cheaper in Binny's but for the most part it's the cheapest game in town. Cash only.Parking can be tough.It only seems to get busier at night. The Police drive around this block frequently so you know stuff is going down regular in the vicinity. I feel like I'm starting to reveal too much about myself now that I'm reviewing Liquor stores. Let's just say I've been to a few.

37.description: Are you throwing a party or are you a beer connoisseur? This place is awesome. It is the cheapest liquor store with the largest selection you will ever find. If you live south or can be near this store, it is worth the drive. You can buy in bulk and get an even better price on wine and champaign.

21.description: Hands down, BEST prices and BEST liquor selection in town (...or around town.)  However, the parking lot is a joke.  Only holds a couple dozen cars and the parking situation makes you feel like you're going to hit a patron or another car regardless of which way you try to maneuver your vehicle.  I typically park in the residential side streets to avoid the lot altogether.  Would also be VERY nice if I could use my debit card or a credit card because I usually stock up, spending way too much to cover with the little amount of cash I usually carry.  I had to blow the dust off my checkbook cover the last time I was there because I didn't have enough cash and they wouldn't take my card.  Alas, even these things don't keep me from shopping there though, the prices are just too great.

16.description: I come here for their craft beer, which they have gotten much about about organizing in the past year or so. They have the best prices in the neighborhood as well as a  great selection. My only complaint is that they keep practically none of the good stuff in the fridge... not the end of the world.  Oh yeah, and cash only is kind of a pain. However the prices here definitely make the trip here worthwhile, instead of George's, who sometimes charge $3+ more for a six pack than Kenwood does. Their beer guy knows his stuff as well.

17.description: Great prices, great selection.Just make sure you have no one under 21 in your car. They have people patrolling the parking lot and the nearby street, staring into your car to make sure you don't buy for underagers. Creepy and annoying, but.Oh, and they don't take credit cards.

10.description: **Cash only**I love this liquor store. The prices are crazy cheap. The staff is always asking if you'd like help and they have helped me pick out various gifts that have always been well received. I just have to constantly remind myself of the cash only thing. There is an ATM inside though if you forget.

11.description: I love this place. From the helpful staff down to the whole retro, neighborhood go-to, kitchy vibe, this store makes me so happy!As for the parking complaints, well.  The small lot is often packed because of the selection and prices, duh!  I find the occasional minor inconvenience completely worth it. Denise in particular is always super helpful and knowledgeable, especially regarding wines.  She'll help you find what you need and send you on your way with a smile.  And yeah, I've come across a curmudgeon or two in the establishment as well.  I get a kick out it, I think it adds to the charm.  If you expect corporate prices and stale, disingenuous corporate customer service, then be my guest and grab your overpriced crappy beer at Jewel.  They now accept credit as well as cash, though I didn't mind when they didn't.  I just moved from Chicago Ridge to pretty far north of Kenwood, but I plan on making trips down to this store now and again.  I think this spot is really endearing, down to the blinking lights of their 50s sign out front!

26.description: I grew up in the southwest 'burbs. My parents used to buy booze from Kenwood, so for the last two years we headed to Oak Lawn to pick up some beer for our holiday party. By "we" I mean myself and my girlfriend. The last time we went, we were told they did not accept state ID's as a valid form of identification. That is not legal. Even so, we went in this time and I decided to purchase the alcohol because I have a valid driver's license. I handed the cashier my license, and--with serious attitude--she demanded to see my girlfriend's license. I said she has a valid state ID, but doesn't drive. She said she could not sell a 27-year-old woman and her 27-year-old partner a 12-pack of beer because she does not have a driver's license? That is NOT legal. The cashier tells me it is an Oak Lawn policy. That is false. It is an ILLEGAL store policy. Also, I find it strange that no one else I know has had that problem. I never pull the "homophobia" card--but I'm pulling it now. We were CLEARLY discriminated against. Also, their cash-only policy is suspect. I feel like if this place were even mildly investigated--there would be some dirt. I've seen better alcohol prices at Jewel, and I really hope the Village of Oak Lawn does something about their illegal and discriminatory policy. Kenwood will never see a dime of mine--or my family's--money again. I also plan on being very vocal about my experience there.

27.description: I don't get the hype.  I've been to this store twice now, and always have a bad experience.  Parking is a nightmare, it's VERY hard to find anything, forget about needing to ask for help, and as for prices, really, compare around, it's nothing special.  I wasn't aware by any sort of signage at all that they didn't take credit cards, which was a massive inconvenience.  Overall, that big of a hassle to save maybe a dollar? No thanks.  The logic of driving that far out of my way and wasting that much gas to save pennies just doesn't make sense.For my buck, I'd rather go to Stadium Liquors in Burbank.

35.description: Best and cheapest liquor store ever.  Holy fuck.

8.description: PRE-NOTE: Paste this into your youtube browser, NOW! Händel Messiah - Hallelujah ChorusDo eeeeeet! Only this song will justify the feeling I had this past Saturday when I sauntered on in to Kenwood *It'sall good!") to stock up on some holiday spirits. After plopping down an obnoxious amount of alcohol on the counter and waiting to hear the death toll, I strained my shoulder while taking out the giant wad of cash I had extracted from my bank's nearest ATM. While I was taking in a deep breath in preparation to pull it from my wallet, I noticed a strange blinking device on the counter with a small computer screen and what seemed to be a swiping strip for a credit card. ..in Kenwood?!  I stared for a moment, captivated as people behind me started to angrily grunt to express their dissatisfaction in waiting an extra thirty seconds. I finally spoke to the cashier, eyebrows furrowed in confusion.Me: "...the hell is that?!"Cashier: "Six weeks now."Me: "What?! It's a Christmas miracle! I'll hang onto these Benjamin Franklins, if you don't mind sir...I'll take full advantage of this!"The cashier looked at me in confusion, though I'd like to think he was in awe of my personal discovery. I've been griping about Kenwood not having modern payment options since 1999! I nearly kissed him before swiping up my booze (Which they packed lovingly into a nice, easy-carry box.) Skipping out the door, I bid a Merry Christmas to the stock boys, whom stared at me with equal confusion. They do then, were in awe!Merry Christmas and happy shopping!

0.description: Forget about Binnys, Kenwood has the best customer service around, Dave Larry Justin John Andy Tim.... All of them! Superb selection, great prices, they don't mark up the popular beers like Binny's does! They certainly reward customer loyalty. And I love how even today after so many years they are not comfortable just doing the same thing they are always looking to improve the experience for the customers. Great job guys see you on my next beer run.!

38.description: This place has a huge selection of wine beer and liquor.  If there is something out of the ordinary that I am specifically looking for than most likely they have it here.  The prices are reasonable and did I mention that they have a huge selection!  This place can get very crowded and they do not have a very big parking lot.  Your best bet is park on the side street.

20.description: The best way to describe the parking lot here is,  Mad Max beyond thunderdome. save yerself the hassle of the cash only policy and purchase your boose and any one of a hundred different stores in the area. If saving 25 cents is an issue for you, shop here.

I've seen better alcohol prices at Jewel, and I really hope the Village of Oak Lawn does something about their illegal and discriminatory policy. Kenwood will never see a dime of mine--or my family's--money again. I also plan on being very vocal about my experience there.

33.description: Low prices and great selection. My only qualm with this store is that if you go on a weekend or holiday, the parking lot is ridiculous! People always coming and going - which is a review in itself!

2.description: Kenwood is a suburban gem! The Good: * Prices here are the lowest around, no city tax since you're in the burbs! Yes, even better than any Binny's.* The selection here is tits. Looking for something you can't find anywhere else? These people probably have it. I've never been disappointed by not being able to find what I went in for. * They always have samples. Now I do have a qualm about this because it's always things that everyone already knows about. Jack Daniels, Malibu, etc. If I'm going to be persuaded into buying something, I want it to be new and exciting! Whatever.The Bad * When you enter, it's hard to navigate through because there is an overwhelming amount of product stacked like a corn maze at the entrance. The Ugly* The parking lot. Ughhhhh it's awful. Obviously The Bad and The Ugly are not serious enough to dock any stars because this place is amazing.

34.description: + Low, low prices+ Huge Selection+ Generally friendly and helpful staff- Insanely busy around holidays- Not nearly enough parking especially on holidays. (I once had to park on a side street two blocks over west of the store and walk.  I made the mistake of letting my dad sucker me into going there on a Friday before a holiday weekend.)- They only take cash, but as long as you know that before you get there it's not a problem.Despite the negatives this truly is a 5 place.  It is well worth the trip.

32.description: This place is fantastic.  First off, they only accept cash, but they do have an ATM in the store.  Prices are cheap, the selection is HUGE, and the staff is very helpful when you're trying to locate something.  It's not glamourous, but it's a liquor store.  The lines were absurd on New Year's Eve at about 4:30, but that's my own fault for waiting until then to go get booze.  Parking is a bit tricky, but there is street parking so if the lot's full, it's worth the walk rather than waiting to get a spot.

18.description: OMG! This place is like Toy's R Us for adults! We actually like the new one in Homer Glen better and go there now that it is open. Their everyday prices are better than any other. Yes, they beat the hell out of everyone, even Binny's. Also, if you can't find what you are looking for here, it isn't available anywhere. Saturdays they always have tastings which is great, but it really makes the store crowded. Believe me when I say, this is worth the drive, regardless of how far away it may seem!

13.description: I came here with my friend who had been coming here for years and said it was an inexpensive place with a very good selection. I figured why not? So we walk in and the lady and the older gentleman were very nice and friendly, and the selection was indeed good.After we picked out our beers, we went to go pay, and that's when things went downhill. My friend was ahead of me and went to go pay, and when he was carded he gave the nice lady his state ID. That's when this short gentlemen rudely interrupted and said "We only take Driver's licenses". I butted in and asked him "Really? It's a valid ID though".He offered no clarification, no explanation, he just rudely stated again "We only take driver's licenses", not even looking us in the eyes.I'm sorry, but we're not there to drive a car, we're there to buy liquor. A state ID is more than adequate for this purpose, as it is a state ID that proves your identity and age, and is accepted everywhere else.Then a couple of days later my younger friend in her mid 20's who always gets carded everywhere we go bought liquor there and said her state ID was just fine, so either the rules are flexible for some people, or the guy decided he was having a bad day and took it out on us.Either way, Mr. Napoleon Complex and the lack of accepting credit cards outweighs the savings, so I'd rather take my business elsewhere. However I do want to thank the lady and the older gentleman, as well as the stock person roaming the isles though for being nice at least.

4.description: Its been said before and it will be said again, this place is a true gem. Anywhere that has dolly's as well as carts is clearly a winner. Sure, the parking lot is small and the place is crowded. I don't know what size parking lot you're expecting from a Cicero front corner store that is surrounded by residences in the back, OR, why you'd like your liquor store to be a ghost town. Its busy because its cheap and has good customer service. The lot is small because the neighborhood is old, as is the location. I myself kind of enjoy the entrance where you're greeted by every dirty 30 they've got in stock, including Strohs (which is awesome fyi).They do this so you don't have to carry the really heavy stuff halfway across the store (or so I imagine, thanks for thinking of me Kenwood!) Once you've made it past the college carry-alls of Natty Ice and Keystone you're embraced by the well stocked aisles of wine, liquor and beer. Sure, it doesn't have quite the breadth of offerings like Binny's, but it also doesn't occupy an old bowling alley, so instead of crying about it, why don't you go brave the small parking lot and buy an entire trunk full of booze using their dollys so you don't have to come back as often...

24.description: OMG! This place is like Toy's R Us for adults! We actually like the new one in Homer Glen better and go there now that it is open. Their everyday prices are better than any other. Yes, they beat the hell out of everyone, even Binny's. Also, if you can't find what you are looking for here, it isn't available anywhere. Saturdays they always have tastings which is great, but it really makes the store crowded. Believe me when I say, this is worth the drive, regardless of how far away it may seem!

6.description: No parking even though they have a decent lot.   It sobusy.   I feel like I walking through  a cattle run.   Iwould rather go elsewhere with low prices.   There are many other stores in the ares.

22.description: Great prices, great selection.Just make sure you have no one under 21 in your car. They have people patrolling the parking lot and the nearby street, staring into your car to make sure you don't buy for underagers. Creepy and annoying, but.Oh, and they don't take credit cards.

15.description: Go-to place for liquor in this area! You won't find any other place that's cheaper than Kenwood. The downsides: it's usually quite packed (especially on weekends) so parking is a pain, space inside is pretty cramped and for as long as I've been coming here, they only take cash. However, what I love is that we can find anything we want here and we're paying less than what you'd pay at other grocery & liquor stores. My husband's favorite bargain here: they sell bundles of Monster (24 cans in all) for a seriously discounted price.

7.description: This place has always had the best liquor pricing in the area. The parking lot is tight, but there are additional spots on the side street as well as about a dozen spaces on the north side of the building. The few problems I had with Kenwood several years ago have been addressed: they now accept credit/debit cards and their craft beer selection has grown immensely. Plus sometimes they'll have crazy-low pricing on overstock.

36.description: Great prices and good selection...Very crowded during the holidays , not enough parking..I need to  pickup some Patron'..

30.description: Amazing prices and Russian Standard Vodka!!

3.description: Best selection of liquor in the area. You name it, they got it. Amazing, never-ending variety of liquor, beer & wine. This includes the high-end items like Don Julio 1942 & Shafer one point five select cabernet sauvignon. Very small parking lot, only park here if you can magically maneuver your car! Wine gift bags also sold here for you last minute gift givers.

14.description: The prices here are the lowest I have ever seen in my life.  The selection of alcohol here has everything you need.  The workers here are very knowledgeable with all types of alcohol (there are different wine and alcohol specialists).  They also have a good amount of sampling going on during the weekends.The only downside is the store and parking lot is a bit small, so it does get a bit cramped.  Last time I checked, they still don't take credit card.  Aside from that it's still worth it as I'll drive 20 min from my home to shop here.

0.description: deana is awesome ..great cuts for the kids only 5-10$Cut and color 65$ Eyebrows wax 10

1.description: I went there this morning to get some breakfast for my family.  I was excited when I got there because they were doing a survey in the drive thru where you got a $2 gift card.  Score.  So I took the survey and gave them good answers because everything was going great...until I got home and realized my entire order was wrong!

0.description: It took 10 minutes to get my bacon, egg & cheese bagel. The people there were vary rude and obnoxious! And they didn't even apologize.

1.description: Nasty attitude,cashier Karla if that's her name didn't  even greet me when I said hi looked like she didn't even want to be there. Why do they hire these useless people that just want to collect a paycheck and make shoppers not want to come back.

2.description: This is a horrid store.  It gives a bad name to a really great company.  We went here today, 12/7/2013.  Not only is this store small, it's a miserable experience with poor management.  The store was packed for no real reason, but that's of course not their fault.  What was their fault was the filthy floors and baseball and other cards and boxes all over the ground at checkout, and the 20 minutes+ it took to checkout!  I counted at least SEVEN people who worked here yet nothing was getting done in a prompt manner!  There were four checkout lanes open and being used, and the dozens of people in line waited forever for a store WITH EVERYTHING PRICED AS A DOLLAR to checkout!  The credit card machine took about 2 minutes to take my payment that usually takes seconds.  To top it off, the parking is packed and sucks as well.    If this store was any slower, it'd automatically turn into a molasses factory!  Never again.    Please go to the Merrionette Dollar Tree instead, it's fast, neater, and much, much larger!!

0.description: Yeah this place is kind of a dump.  I go there because it's close to my house and I have a few items I but there regularly.  The line is always long and the place is always a mess.  The employees are rude too.  I used a basket once when I was in there and after I was done putting my items on the counter I put my basket on top of the other baskets that were next to the counter.  The cashier was like that's not where they go, huffed at me, and moved the whole stack of baskets by the front door.  Sorry lady, the other five baskets must of thrown me off.

3.description: Horrible service. I asked for no chip manicure and the lady kept saying acrylic.  I kept telling her no that they were my real nails not fake ones and she kept insisting and I kept telling her no. When I thought she had gotten the point she tried to pull my nail off!  Never going there again!

1.description: Horrible experience.  Bad service...The girl was watching a movie on her phone while she was doing my nails. She didn't do what I wanted.  Never going back!

2.description: So decided to give them another shot even though it's new management. Ugh, bad idea. Had bad experience with pedicure. Lets just say I walked out limping with a bandaid, no apologies, and no discount. Manager was there, she seen, and nothing. Never again. Im picky with nail salons, miss the old management :( . After some searching finally found my new spot, I highly recommend the new place I go to yelp.com/biz/e-nails-chi…

5.description: I must say that I was very pleased the way my nails came out today my first time here, I got the PINK&WHITE set, it's more expensive than the acrylic or gel nails, but well worth it! Vu did my nails, he is good! I will definetely come back!!!!!

0.description: This used to be my regular go to. However, recently there was an ownership change. While there are two or three ladies from previous owners that still work here, overall it has gone downhill. I used to love this place now I'm on Yelp looking for a replacement. Cleanliness, friendliness, and overall feeling is no longer acceptable.

4.description: Terrible service, the place was extremely dirty. The woman who was doing my nails used dirty utensils and didn't bother cleaning up the women's mess before me. She actually had nail clippings all over her station. Definitely never going back!
